name: Overall
statement: The overall score is derived from the cummulative average of percent of positive responses to all statement/questions in the Viewpoint Survey.

children.name: Employee Engagement Index
children.statement: Score derived from cummulative average of all statements in this section.

children.name: Diversity Management
children.statement: Supervisors work well with employees of different backgrounds.

children.name: Verticle Communication
children.statement: Managers communicate the goals and priorities of the organization.

children.name: Goal-Orientation
children.statement: Managers review and evaluate the organization's progress toward meeting its goals and objectives.

children.name: Overall Leadership Performance
children.statement: Overall, how good a job do you feel is being done by the manager directly above your immediate supervisor?

children.name: Foster Collaboration
children.statement: Managers support collaboration across work units to accomplish work objectives.

children.name: Program Support
children.statement: Senior leaders demonstrate support for Work/Life programs.

children.name: Respectability
children.statement: I have a high level of respect for my organization's senior leaders.

children.name: Lateral Communication
children.statement: Managers promote communication among different work units.

children.name: Integrity
children.statement: My organization's leaders maintain high standards of honesty and integrity.

children.name: Motivational
children.statement: In my organization, leaders generate high levels of motivation and commitment in the workforce.

children.name: Global Satisfaction Index
children.statement: Score derived from cummulative average of all statements in this section.

children.name: Safety
children.statement: Employees are protected from health and safety hazards on the job.

children.name: Threat Preparedness
children.statement: My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.

children.name: Mission Focus
children.statement: My agency is successful at accomplishing its mission.

children.name: Skills Alignment
children.statement: The workforce has the job-relevant knowledge and skills necessary to accomplish organizational goals.

children.name: Inclusiveness
children.statement: Prohibited personnel practices are not tolerated.

children.name: Positive Work Environment
children.statement: I recommend my organization as a good place to work.

children.name: Diversity
children.statement: Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace.

children.name: Apoliticism
children.statement: Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.

children.name: Recognition
children.statement: Employees are recognized for providing high quality products and services.

children.name: Empowerment
children.statement: Employees have a feeling of personal empowerment with respect to work processes.

children.name: Action-Orientation
children.statement: I believe the results of this survey will be used to make my agency a better place to work.

children.name: Innovative Culture
children.statement: Creativity and innovation are rewarded.

children.name: Meritocracy
children.statement: Pay raises depend on how well employees perform their jobs.

children.name: New IQ Index
children.statement: Score derived from cummulative average of all statements in this section.

children.name: Work
children.statement: Considering everything, how satisfied are you with your job?

children.name: Pay
children.statement: Considering everything, how satisfied are you with your pay?

children.name: Organization
children.statement: Considering everything, how satisfied are you with your organization?

children.name: Development Opportunities
children.statement: How satisfied are you with the training you receive for your present job?

children.name: Democratic Decision-Making
children.statement: How satisfied are you with your involvement in decisions that affect your work?

children.name: Transparency
children.statement: How satisfied are you with the information you receive from management on what's going on in your organization?

children.name: Recognition
children.statement: How satisfied are you with the recognition you receive for doing a good job?

children.name: Policy Appropriateness
children.statement: How satisfied are you with the policies and practices of your senior leaders?

children.name: Growth Opportunity
children.statement: How satisfied are you with your opportunity to get a better job in your organization?

children.name: HCAAF Indicies
children.statement: Score derived from cummulative average of all statements in this section.

children.name: Respectfulness
children.statement: My supervisor treats me with respect.

children.name: Work-Life Support
children.statement: My supervisor supports my need to balance work and other life issues.

children.name: Feedback
children.statement: In the last six months, my supervisor has talked with me about my performance.

children.name: Two-Way Communication
children.statement: My supervisor listens to what I have to say.

children.name: Overall
children.statement: Overall, how good a job do you feel is being done by your immediate supervisor?

children.name: Workforce Diversity
children.statement: My supervisor is committed to a workforce representative of all segments of society.

children.name: Trustworthiness
children.statement: I have trust and confidence in my supervisor.

children.name: Leadership Development
children.statement: My supervisor provides me with opportunities to demonstrate my leadership skills.

children.name: Professional Development
children.statement: Supervisors in my work unit support employee development.

children.name: Interpersonal Impact
children.statement: Discussions with my supervisor about my performance are worthwhile.

children.name: Constructiveness
children.statement: My supervisor provides me with constructive suggestions to improve my job performance.
